name: Iberostar Bavaro

reviews.text: I'll start out my review with the bad. Only two things, and neither of which was the resorts fault:
reviews.title: Long Review--Great Stay

reviews.text: 1. The weather. Tropical Storm Olga came up in the middle of our stay, which kept us off the beach more than we wanted to be (but there were ice storms back home, so a tropical storm was the lesser of two evils)
reviews.title: just what the doctor ordered
Recent trip from New York
reviews.text: 2. Lack of parenting. I was shocked at how some parents seemed to think that being on vacation also meant that they were also taking time off from their jobs as parents.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1)One night, at one of our reserved dinners (Japanese), a couple with two children had one set up playing in the aisle where the waiters had to STEP OVER THEM WITH TRAYS OF FOOD, HOT COFFEE, ETC. while their other child ran circles around the restaurant. This happened from the time we had our appetizers until our desert when a couple shushed the child as he ran by their table and he went crying to mommy who gave the couple an evil glare. (If the couple that finally shut this child up is reading this I want to thank you again). This also happened a couple of nights at the bar. Later in the evening, kids were running around playing tag and mowing over cocktail waitresses and other patrons.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Boo Tropical Storm Olga

likes.disliked: — The lateness of the rooms being cleaned

reviews.text: 2) Our last 3 mornings we were woken up to screaming. When I walked outside the first morning to see what was going on, I saw a young child (2-3 years old) screaming at a peacock. Then getting closer and screaming again. When I walked outside he was about 3 feet away from it. No parents to be seen. If I had been the peacock, I would have flogged him. The next morning he was out there doing it again to ducks. The third morning we woke up to screaming I stayed inside and hoped that he was doing it to a gator or some other animal with large teeth and an appetite.
reviews.title: Wedding and fun at the Iberostar Bavaro

likes.liked: — The grounds/pool/beach are beautiful and very well maintained.
likes.disliked: — Some of the food wasn't great.

reviews.text: Just returned from 15 day annual trip to Iberostar Bavaro (9th visit). Alex is back as Star Friends Boss!! (from Dominica) Woohoo! He has so much energy. Rodolfo is the best & Luis is the Golden Statue. The Star friends (Joanna, Romeo, Francesca, Mitchell, Daniel, Ceceilio) are fun on the beach & at the shows. They work several hours a day to make you enjoy your vacation. You can participate or sit back & watch, your call.
reviews.title: It's all about the beach!!
Excellent holiday
reviews.text: The beach is awesome....you can walk in either direction for miles. Feed the fish with crumbled bread or banana pieces right off the beach, snorkel or grab a tropical drink (Frozen lemonade on it's own or with Stoli) from Manuel Calderon or Gilbert (Beach Bartenders) They start work at 10am.

The buffet has many wonderful wait staff.....Delmis, Gregory, Diaz, Rigo Francie, Coffee coffee Andy, Mario, Margerhito....Mario will cook you chicken, lamb, steaks pork & will try to feed you 6 of them...steak & ckn fajitas, diff, shrimp tacos with gucamole, Pasta with all veggies sauces.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Vacation at Iberostar Bavaro!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The French restaurant has wonderful Mediterrean Lobster Salad app & wonderful tenderloin.
reviews.title: WOW!!! What a place for a holiday

reviews.text: Cajun Restaurant has wonderful cococnut shrimp on app buffet & blackened grouper entre. Mediterrean restaurant has wonderful veal medalions on app buffet with shrimp, etc.
reviews.title: More was expected...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed from March 1 - 8 2009. We had room 1097. It was on the second floor. The only downside to the room is that it was quite close to the entertainment stage, and it was loud until 11:30pm on most nights, so if you stay up, its not an issue.
reviews.title: Great time, resort not a 5 star, but a strong 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very nice. Flora cleaned our room every day, made the bed, mopped the floor. The minibar was stocked every day also, beer, water, diet coke, coke, orange soda.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation at IB Bavaro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort grounds are gorgeous. Well maintained. There are several areas of shallow water where flamingos and ducks can be seen. There were also a few peacocks on the grounds.
reviews.title: can't fault it

reviews.text: The pool was gorgeous to look at, the water is a little chilly. While we were there it was quite windy, so you didn't really work up a sweat while sitting in the sun. At times the pool area was crowded and chairs were hard to find. We spent a lot of time on the beach, never a problem finding a chair. The wind on the beach was really blowing, so we set up other chairs to block the wind, other people did this as well.
reviews.title: Great food, drinks, beach, room, staff

reviews.text: The beach was beautiful. The water was a little rough, not good for snorkeling or swimming really, the red flags were flying most days we were there. We still went in, and we snorkeled a couple times and did see fish.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Bavaro was the week of 11-04-06 thru 11-12-06.
reviews.title: Great Vacation !!!

likes.disliked: — There is a musky smell in the older rooms.

reviews.title: Near Death Experience
reviews.text: This is my first review and I am only writing it because the reviews we read before the trip were so helpful / informative.
When I read negative reviews about this resort I wonder if these guys were staying at the same place we did or are they just impossible to please.
reviews.title: Returning soon for the 5th Time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To begin the Bavaro is in the Dominican Republic not New York or Paris so to compare a 5 star there to here would be unfair.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL Vacation!!!

likes.liked: — The resort was just BEAUTIFUL. Everything was perfect.
likes.disliked: — Being forced to make reservations for dinner.

reviews.text: The resort was very clean. The service , except for the beach area, was outstanding. The entire staff was outgoing and freindly.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: I will admit that this was my very 1st trip outside of the US and at an All Inclusive so I really don't have anything else to compare it to but aside from that - There was nothing about this trip that I would want to change! I have been reading these reviews for the past 6 months or so, I read so many reviews - we were initially booked to stay at the Iberostar Punta Cana and then I started to see bad reviews, I got nervous and finally decided to upgrade to the Iberostar Bavaro. I don't know that there was any reason to do that in the end... I saw nothing wrong with the Punta Cana or the Dominicana but I was very happy at the Bavaro. Our arrival was fine - we were bombarded by people that want to take your bags for you. I was forwarned that this was not neccessary but they were extremely insistent. In the end, I really didn't know where I was going anyway so we let someone help us. He charged us $ 5.00 "tip" thought it was strange that they would tell you how much to tip but hey... you're on vacation and I didn't need to figure out where we needed to be so we gave him the five bucks. The bus ride to the resort was pretty impressive. It was a HUGE tour bus with tinted windows, wonderful air conditioning and big comfortable seats. A nice surprise. It only took about 25 minutes to get to the resort. Check in was nice and easy. We had a couple of specific requests in regards to our room - I had asked for 2nd floor - Two double beds - near pool / beach. It turned out that they did not get those requests from my travel agent but they had no problem changing our room to meet our requests. Very nice. The pool is amazing - the beach is amazing - the grounds are immaculate - the service was wonderful what else can I say? Everything was perfect. And as far as worrying about the language barrier? I really had no problem - when someone couldn't understand me I would do some charades and everyone would figure out what I was asking about! It was fun. I learned some key words in Spanish and it really wasn't a problem. I traveled with my husband and my two boys ages 11 and 8. The 11 yr old got involved with all types of sporting events that they had - beach volleyball - soccer - ping pong tournaments etc... The 8 yr old fell head over heels in love with the star friends that run the "Lucy Club" Shout out to Rosa!! You were amazing... thank you. I would suggest that you invest in a pair of decent walkie talkies. We brought ours and it was a godsend. We were able to let him call us whenever he wanted to leave (which was never) if you don't have this there really is no way of knowing where your child is at any given moment. They change from station to station throughout the whole day so that could be a problem. Our room was great - I personally did not find the hairdryer to be such an issue as people have said but I don't really use it to do a lot either so use your own judgement on whether to bring one or not. I did bring my own but I did not end up using it. Oh one little piece of information that I think is important to pass along is that your sliding glass door to your balcony is tied in with your air conditioning in the room. If your door is not fully closed - your a/c will shut off. There also is no on/off switch for your a/c - it just runs non-stop and there is no temperature control either so don't bother searching the walls for it as we did. We had no complaints regarding the a/c it was perfectly acceptable and you can control the speed of the overhead fan with a switch on the wall by the bed. We had to call a technician because we thought everything was broken when the air would not turn on when in fact my son had not closed the slider properly. PS. The service tech was rather slow getting there but didn't we feel the fool once we were told how it works... Our tour rep at the Bavaro was Hector (with Preito Tours) I can not say enough about this gentleman! He went out of his way (literally!!) to make sure we had a great time. He was honest about the excursions and told us what to expect and which ones are the best deal for the money. We went on the Carribean Festival which was a blast - the bus picked you up and took you to the marina and then you board a huge ferry type boat with two levels - the staff that run this are wonderful - friendly and funny and they put on shows while you are enroute. And then we swam with the stingrays and the nurse sharks and the whole trip lasted about 4 hours. I thought it was a good time (cost us $ 287.00 for two adults and two children) and then we did the Dolphin Island excursion - I went back and forth trying to decide whether or not we wanted to spend this much... $ 120.00 per person regardless of age. Finally I decided I had no idea when we would be taking another trip like this so we did it - my husband went as a spectator (only $ 20.00) and he was able to take all the pictures he wanted from the sidelines. It was fantastic! We had a blast!! Our tour guides for this excursion take you in a speed boat out to the dolphin area and then you get a good solid 1/2 hour in the water with the dolphins. Our guide (Junior... hello Junior!) let both of my boys steer the boat on the way back and they were thrilled with that. The food: I have to say, some of us are pretty picky eaters and don't like a lot of things. If you can't find something to eat here... that's just crazy. You may not LOVE everything - things are very different here, even Coca Cola and Sprite tastes different but it was fine - we had no problems and no one got sick on anything. There is a drink here called Mamawanna - It's sort of like a brandy - they call it the Dominican's Viagra! HA! I find that hard to believe.. if you get into your second one of these you are going nighty night very quickly! It had a wonderful taste though (get is served on ICE it tastes much better) and then only sip it... Other than that I really enjoyed their Pina Colada's and their Banannamama's (frozen) Nice! Our tour rep Hector warned us about the Colada's they use some type of coconut milk and he said it can act as a natural laxative so be careful how many you might consume. The most impressive thing I found here was two things: 1) These people love their job. Not just doing a job, they really truly seem to enjoy it and they work SO long and SO hard. (tip them.. they deserve it) and 2) the workmanship, if you look at how things are made and how sturdy every piece of furniture is it really is amazing, I wish Americans took as much pride in their work as these people obviously do. Ok if there was one thing that I didn't care for I would have to say it was "vendor" night. Friday night they had a whole bunch of vendors that lined the walkways and lobby area. I really just wanted to browse around and look at all the different things but they were all so pushy that it made it too difficult to do. I was really sort of dissappointed with that but I also did not want to have to keep fighting to say no. We brought a lot of one's with us for tipping as people suggested and I was thrilled that no one seemed to expect a tip or hang around waiting for one either. It makes tipping that much more enjoyable! Feel free to ask me anything you'd like and I'll answer to the best of my ability. I know I was a little nervous about whether my kids would have enough to keep them busy... No worries - they'll have a ball.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth!

reviews.text: Before I visited Iberostar Bavaro in Punta Cana, I read lots of reviews on this site to get familiar with the hotel and everything that goes with it. I just want to say that my family had a terrific time from beginning to end. We stayed for 5 days and it was just enough time to do all we wanted to do. We really enjoyed the events at the pool each day and the entertainment each evening was terrific! The entertainers were sooo funny and made us laugh, even if it was at ourselves! My husband got picked one night to be on stage and be part of the act. To this day he regrets it, but what fun stories we have to tell our family and friends! The videocamera was a great tool to capture the beauty and enjoyment we experienced. I took over 300 pictures because I wanted to bring my whole trip home and didn't want to forget anything. The food was very good and there were too many types to choose from. I bet they do that to make sure they don't forget that there are people from all over the world who have somewhat different food choices during each meal. The cooks were always very friendly and had a smile on their face for each one of us. We chose one dinner to make a reservation for, but truthfully, the buffet dinners were our first choice each night, because we had as much as we wanted and got to pick from so many types. My kids preferred the pizza, hot dogs, chicken, and the french fries. They also had some salad and fruit. I tried a salad that had sliced deli meat in it that I would really like to make at home. The employees went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. It's good to know a bit of Spanish before you go because the restaurant people know little English. We had a blast learning more of their language and teaching them some of ours. The flea market was a one-time visit because they can make you feel bad if you don't buy something from them. Overall, we had a lovely time, enjoyed the weather, the people and all who worked there.
reviews.title: An Amazing and Fun Vacation for Families

reviews.text: What a delightful time! Be prepared with a smile as you enter the airport in the Dominican Rep. your photo will be taken and upon your departure you will have the opportunity to view and purchase it. Then you'll hand your $10 over and get your tourist card...which you will then promptly hand to someone else.
reviews.title: Paradise Found

reviews.text: Our trip was booked with Apple vacations and all was wonderful. The Apple rep was fantastic on site as well. Every person we met was kind, hard working and fantastic. One little bit less enthusiastic worker was the woman at the front desk...she had no desire to move our room closer for an ocean view. It truly didn't matter, but we gave it an unsuccessful try.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service, Beautiful Lush Grounds, Awesome Beach!

reviews.text: Booking the a la cartes was smooth: Gourmet-Unbelievably lovely....Cajun-Fantastic Steakhouse...might not repeat, but was fine (least fancy/fun) Mediterranean-Delightful
reviews.title: Great Family and Adult vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just arrived from our trip and want to go back! We have to stay this is one of the best beach vacations we've had and we've had quite a few. Our room was clean and spacious, the food was above average, the property is very well maintained and the staff was wonderful.
reviews.title: Loved the BAVARO

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, beach resort and great staff
likes.disliked: — have to pay for internet use

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this place! If we have to add a few suggestions: the checkin staff gave us a room next to a building being renovated without realizing it. We had to get transferred to another room which they did immediately. Also, the checkin staff should have access to more staff as the lines get longer. A few times we saw 1 staff member handling a line of more than 10 people.
reviews.title: Bravo for Bavaro

likes.disliked: — Requested a certian buildind well in advance and did not recieve, but the room we ended up w/ was great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Iberostar Bavaro from March 10-17, 2007 to celebrate our 10 yr. anniversary and had a wonderful time!! I'll break down our experience so it is easier to follow.
reviews.title: Best time ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival: We booked through Apple Vacations and this is the way to go. Everything runs smoothly from start to finish. Although, do hold onto your $10 tourist card that they give you. Everyone says that you get it at one place and hand it in at the next. This is not true. The next window she stamps your passport, but you go about 30 steps and then hand your tourist card to another gentleman. There was some confusion with my husband's card, but all worked out okay. Ride to the hotel was about 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Beautiful
Great family trip to Bavaro
reviews.text: Check-in/rooms: Check in was a breeze. We faxed and e-mailed a room request prior to our trip and slipped Gilberto a $20 and we received a wonderful room just one row back from the beach. Definitely request a renovated room, they are worth it! We couldn't get a king size bed that close to the beach, but they pushed two doubles together and it was fine. We had no problems with our room and be sure to tip the maid and bring some small gifts for her. She works hard and deserves it.

Beach: What else can I say except outstanding! We spent almost everyday at the beach, not bothering with the pool. Chairs are always available, but you must get up very early for a cabana. They say no reserving of chairs/huts, but everyone does and no one bothers your stuff when you leave it unattended. Beach is immaculant and they are always cleaning it. Great beach bar! Tell Leonardo Frank says Hola!! Take your own insulated mug to keep drinks longer and they have no problem filling them up at the bars. No worries about them rinsing out with tap water. This is an optional topless beach and many do go topless, but no one seems to care. Very relaxing. Definitely go to the beach market and haggle! Never pay more than 25% of initial asking price. No more than $3/cigar. You'll get great deals on great cigars! The only down side to the beach is the chairs. They do not lay flat. This started to bother our backs when we would lay on our stomach. Not sure why these chairs are like this when the ones at the pool go flat, but this is something I wish they would change.
reviews.title: Unforgettable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: The LaCouples (gourmet) restaurant is outstanding!!!! We had the lobster salad and dark and white choc dessert. I had the grouper and my husband the shrimp and it was all excellent. Great service too. We also ate at the steakhouse and Cajun. Steakhouse is way overrated. Service was slow and the meat was undercooked. We asked for medium well and it was all but raw! Cajun was good, with a buffet for appetizers and dessert. Regular buffet is good with plenty to choose from. Wednesday is lobster (king prawn) night so don't miss it. We ate lunch at the beach bar or pool buffet for lunch. Great dogs and fries at the beach bar and lots of good stuff at the pool buffet. You can go to this buffet in swim suits, no shirts for guys and barefoot. Ice cream hut is great!!
reviews.title: PARADISE!!!!!

likes.liked: — Friendly, helpful staff, and THE BEACH!
likes.disliked: — There wasn't anything I didn't like!

reviews.title: Over Rated
reviews.text: we visited Iberostar Punta Cana for our honeymoon and were told that we would be treated like a king and queen. Not so. We were placed next to the utility room (room 5120) and were awoken every day by 7:30am by noisy water pipes, the service entrance behind our room and the very noisy staff yelling across the hallways to one another. No welcome basket came to our room as we were told it would. On our 4th day a plate of cut fruit arrived with an invitation for a romantic dinner that ocurred the day before! That was our special thank you! Not the champagne, just maried t-shirts and fruit basket we were told was coming!

The food was barely cooked. First day I bit into a raw piece of chicken at the beach bar. By day three I was eating rolls with butter..too afraid to eat the meat. Day 5 my new husbad ate 1/2 of a uncooked burger and had to induce vomitting to aviod illness. Luckily my husband speaks Spanish and the waiter told him to do so.
reviews.title: Bavaro is the place to stay
SImply First Class in Every Respect
reviews.text: Drinks were OK. Should have been blended not just poured, daquiri's were sour, and most drinks were served warm or with a slight chill. Do try the mamajuana... it's wonderful!
Entertainment was totally amature. Not what we expected from a 5 star resort. how many nights in a row can they teach the bachata.
reviews.title: A Fabulous Family Vacation

reviews.text: Our honeymoon was a wedding gift from our parents so we didnt have to spend or save hard earned money. If it were our own money we would have been utterly dissapointed.
reviews.title: I want to go back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great trip overall, the hotel was fabulous. The workers at the hotel were all nice and went out of their way to make sure you had a good time. They always had smiles on their faces and remembered you. They danced and sung while they worked and their service was great.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: The entire property has junior suites, which are pretty large. The rooms all have a terrance or balcony, depending on your floor. We had a king size bed which was large and comfortable. You have TVs in the room with english channels, a minibar with water, soda, beer. The bathrooms were new and large as well, with always warm water from the shower. The rooms do have a mildewy smell, even the renovated rooms, but you get over it quick, you aren't in there too much.
reviews.title: We Loved the Iberostar Bravaro

reviews.text: Food: Buffet was good, lots of options. Wednesday night is lobster night, caribbean lobster, so small with about 3 forkfuls of lobster tail meat...but to me it was much sweeter adn delicious than Maine lobster. Also they have dorado, local white fish, pasta, salads, fruits, breads, cheeses at all the meals. Specialty restaruants, we went to Gourmet (get the lobster appetizer, it was the best!), which was pretty good. And we went to the mediterrean restuarant, which had an aweseome appetizer buffet. As for wine, not good, skip it all together. Go for the bohemia beer or drinks at the bar. Also, we drank the water and ice cubes, no problems with GI system, they filter their own water there, so it doesn't do you in.
reviews.title: Still love this place so much

reviews.text: Beaches: Fabulous! White sand, clear water, absolutely amazing. We walked for hours every day in either direction, gorgeous beach and very safe. Many europeans, so topless women and speedos for men is a common site. Water was clean, warm and great to swim in. Snorkeling off hotel property wasn't bad, lots of fish and some coral, but not the best. Would take a trip next time.
reviews.title: Only the most spoiled would complain about this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool: Nice, but didn't spend a lot of time there, beach is nicer. But overall nice and clean.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.text: Let's start from the beginning:
reviews.title: The Good, the bad, and the ugly

reviews.text: FLIGHT: AA wonderful. Nonstop, even lunch. Getting through the airport took about 30 minutes and then I had a wonderful driver from VIP take me to the hotel. Speedy!!
reviews.title: Loved the Bavaro, loved the people

reviews.text: CHECK-IN: Very fast and efficient. They gave me my requested room and explained the resort in detail.
reviews.title: Unbelivable Vacation!!

reviews.text: ROOM: Nice and clean. Nothing to fantastic but along the lines of a Marriott. The housekeeper kept the fridge stocked with beverages and cleaned extremely well. I did leave her a generous tip daily.
reviews.title: Sorry we had to leave !

likes.liked: — the friend and helpful staff / the beauty of the resort
likes.disliked: — lack of american choices for alcohol and soft drinks

reviews.text: BEACH: The very reason I came here. Blue water and white sand. Lots of people but no problem finding a chair...in the sun.
reviews.title: We want to go back!

reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend stayed at Iberostar Bavaro 5/1/12-5/10/12. It was hands down the GREATEST vacation I have ever been on. Worth every penny.
reviews.title: Most amazing vacation!!!

reviews.text: The very many PROS:
reviews.title: Beach, breeze, sand surf and good food.

reviews.text: The staff is incredible. Faustino, Dani, Hector, Tomas, Rudy, Gregory, Silvestre, Wilkins, all the "Star Friends" I personally would like to thank them for making my vacation the best it could be. You could be at the pool at 9am and see Hector cleaning up the pool bar getting it ready for the day, then go to the lobby bar that 10pm and there he would be! Smiling & making everyone laugh. God knows most people couldn't work that long and still be singing & dancing around. Not too mention they WORK. Never see one of them just sitting around. If I could pick my one FAVORITE thing about the Iberostar Bavaro I would pick the staff hands down everytime.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms, incredible. I don't think any room can really have a "bad veiw". Trees, flowers & wildlife EVERYWHERE!
reviews.title: Not up to the hype it was given by Apple or Funjet ratings

reviews.text: Bathrooms are always being cleaned, Buffet/Dining Area too. Never see anything dirty.
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation
Iberostar Bavaro "The Best Of The Best
reviews.text: I just returned from a 7 day stay at the Iberostar Bavaro with my wife and 13 great new friends that we meet from Cleveland OH, we were there from 10-20-06 --- 10-27-06. Let me start by saying that this is was my 9th trip to the DR, 7 to Punta Cana, and 2 to La Ramana, I have also done several all-inclusive in Cancun and 7 or 8 cruises, I don’t want to sound like I’m bragging but the point I want to make is that I have a lot of vacation travel experiences. Also I would like to note that I have never written or felt compelled to write a review about any of them until now. Let me start out by saying if Apple Vacation serves your area they do a great job of making your vacation a success, the only thing that all of the all-inclusive vacation I have gone on have in common is that they were booked through Apple. As with any small island airport Punta Cana airport is no big lavish place but they do a good job of getting you in country and re-uniting you with your luggage. Don’t let the baggage handlers scare you, this is a poor country, jobs are scarce, they only charge $1.00 a bag to hull your bags out to the bus, you are on vacation, 4 or 5 bags for $5.00 in 90 degree heat, that is a bargain were I come from. Do note these guys are in a hurry so don’t get on the bus until you see them put your bags in the luggage section of the bus, and by all means do not put you purse or carry on bag with your return ticket , passport, camera, money, etc in there keep it with you, this just makes good sense. The ride to the resort is going to take about 30 or 40 minutes the bus is air conditioned and the driver usually will give you a little information about the country to make the time pass by quickly, you may stop at a couple different resorts to drop off a few guest look the resorts over good, you will be coming back and this may be your next vacation home, also on the return trip to the airport ask the people how they like the resort, most are very eager to tell you what they did or did not like about the place.

Now to the vacation let’s start with check in, we arrived about noon, about 3 hours before the official check in time, the lobby of the Bavaro is large and beautiful, it has a classic look with out over doing it. We were greeted at the desk with all smiles and a staff who spoke about as good English as any place in the DR, from this moment to the wave good bye when we left you always felt comfortable and welcome at this resort. Also our room was ready and they let us move right in, this may vary depending on how full the resort is when you vacation, but I do believe that they try hard to get you in quickly, it is just good business and this is a well run business.
reviews.title: It Felt Like Home

reviews.text: Now lets move on to the nuts and bolts, Food, if you are looking for 4 star restraunt type food, you do not belong in any all inclusive resort, but if you are looking for a good variety of food that is hot, tasty, and well presented then this is the place for you. Breakfast and Lunch in all of the resorts I have stayed is served buffet style, for breakfast we were able to choose from eggs cooked any way you liked, fresh made pancakes, French toast, waffles, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit and the list goes on including some of the best fresh made pastry and donuts that you have ever had, and do not miss the fresh fruit drink bar it is to die for. (A little hint do a full a pass of the whole room before you start to load down your plate, all week I herd people asking other guest were they got something, they really do have a lot to choose from). Lunch again a buffet was a good solid offering of hamburgers, hot dogs, steak, chicken, fish, and pasta with a good not great salad bar and several rice and vegetable entries. The dinner buffet was made up of steaks, lamb, pork chops, pasta, fish, and a ton of different dishes, be prepare not all cultures eat what Americans do and you might see some odd looking things being served. I never knew that they could prepare banana’s in so many way’s, be open to new things you may just find a new favorite, remember it is all you can eat so take a small dish and if you don’t like it get something else, there is plenty to choose from. We tried 3 of the al cart restraunts, The Steak House, Japanese, and the Cassiean, all three restraunts offered a well planed menu and the service was very good, we especially like the Japanese, but did not regret going to any of them.
reviews.title: Musty Rooms/Good Staff
Forum gives a false positive on this one!
reviews.text: The room, we ask for and received a recently remodeled room, in the 1100 range. The room was fairly large with a full bath that consisted of a tub, separate shower, sink, and toilet, the lay out could have been a little better but it more then did the job. We had a full American King Size bed, not a small hotel version, that was firm and very comfortable, there was also a couple of small sectional style couches a table, several dresser more then a enough for 2 people to be comfortable. We also had a coffee pot and a well stocked mini bar refrigerator and a 20 to 25” TV, all of the comforts of home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach, this resort like most on Bavero Beach is beautiful , nice white sand, a plus for this resort is the amount of shade huts that it has, they must have 10 times what the average resort has, I have never seen so many and I have stayed at 7 different resorts in the DR. This may not sound large but the sun in the DR will fry you and the shade is a welcome relief when you are not cooking a tan.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.disliked: — The time we went (during low, rainy season)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Iberostar Bavaro from Feb 5 - Feb 12 2009. The staff bent over backwards to make our stay was the best ever. The warmth and smiles from all the staff sure did help a lot to take our minds off the crappy weather that we experienced that week. Hats off to Juanita our room maid.....there is a sign in the room that says the mini bar is only stocked every second day....NOT TRUE...try everyday!!! Awesome lady!! She always made sure there was plenty of beer, pop and water. I heard how at some resorts they seem to be a little cheap on the bottled water for the rooms.....not this place. We had more than enough. She was always smiling and greeted us with a warm Hola everytime she saw us. Mater of fact everyone was always smiling and greeting us too. And what an imaculate room...not one bug to be found. I think the only complaints I would have about the room was the hair dryer is cheesy (I brought my own so no big deal) and the TV didn't work when we arrived. But in less than 5 minutes someone was there to fix it. The serving staff are the most friendly warm people I ever met in my life.Special kudos go to Jorge who never ever allowed our wine glasses to go empty at dinner and what a funny guy...so nice to have someone make you laugh despite the bad weather. Also very honorable mentions goes to waitresses Candy and Santa. Candy was ever so gracious to smile, wave and say "Hola Canada" for our video camera. She even tought us a few words in Spanish. The animation team had me in tears laughing so hard espeacially when we were playing bingo. My boyfriend thought he had a bingo but didn't. The rules of the game is that if you yell bingo but do not really have one....you have to jump in the pool. So my boyfriend played along laughing and hollering "But I am Canadian" while the animation team led him to the pool....they responded by saying in their best english "and you're still going in the pool....eh" Hard to explain by typing it in a review...you had to be there. It was hilarious....I almost peed my pants laughing so hard. And speaking of laughing hard my favorite night time show was a comedy story about tribesmen who have to go under a test of strength....inner strength to resist the temptations of a beautiful woman. If you are at this resort in the future, hope they do this show again. You do not want to miss it....it's hilarious, you'll be in tears laughing so hard. The food....Oh God did we ever gorge ourselves. It was amazing and soooo yummy....I had to try everything only to discover that my eyes were bigger than my stomach. You will never go hungry in this place. Hard to decide which a la carte we liked the best. My boyfriend really loved the mediteranian...he is a big seafood nut and so am I. I loved the cajun.. I am a girl who loves my spices. And even the steakhouse impressed us a lot, and trust me we are from Alberta and like most Albertans we are very fussy about our steaks....yum...juicy. These folk really go out of their way to please.
reviews.title: Bravo Bavaro

likes.liked: — Everything....the food...the people...all of the above

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the Caribbean and we started out good by choosing the best resort. We have no desire to even think about going anywhere else but the Iberostar Bavaro....and we will be back. The only bad thing was the weather. Knowing these folk, they would fix that too if they could.
reviews.title: Solid all-inclusive resort with good food and drink

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving, our check-in host "Franklin" was friendly and laid back. Our room was on the 2nd (top) floor with a cathedral ceiling over the sleeping area, and was nicely appointed and colorfully decorated. A covered deck overlooked a manicured courtyard of tropical plants. The entire resort is immaculately landscaped with hundreds of coconut trees, palms, and flowering plants. Flamingos, ducks, herons, turtles, snails, and fish live in the wetland areas, and it was fun to watch the wildlife and walk around the resort grounds.
reviews.title: Our 8th trip to the caribic - this one was the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The white/pink sand beach stretched as far as the eye could see in both directions. The ocean was warmer than the pool, and most of our stay was in the low 80s, high humidity, and windy, with white caps forming not far from the shore. (Note that Punta Cana is on the eastern shore, not on the calmer southern Caribbean sea.) The buffets were very good, not exactly the same every day, with wonderful deep fried goodies, delicious salty fish, fresh fruit, ad a variety of breads, fresh vegetables and fruits. Friday night was special, when the chefs created elaborate carved fruits in the shape of animals and vendors came to the lobby to sell souvenirs.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Bavaro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was overall excellent, but as in any vacation, not everything was perfect :). Our room wasn't far from the new Grand Bavaro where they were doing some construction on some mornings. For non-smokers, it was difficult to avoid smoke (from cigarettes as well as cigars) in any of the public areas, and on one evening, our room was mysteriously filled with smoke odors, apparently from a neighboring smokers room. We asked the reception the next day but they didn't seem to have non-smoking rooms. There were mosquitoes in the lobby and buffets in the evenings. It took some work to find a empty lounge chairs near the pool or beach, as patrons often left their towels and things on chairs to reserve them even though this was against resort "policy". More conservative folks should note that most patrons at this resort walk around half-naked during the day (in swimwear) and aren't very modest during the day; and topless is allowed on the beach. Finally, the room and dining areas were clean, but not immaculate, we noticed dishes at the buffets weren't always completely clean and the in-room coffeemaker appeared to be only rinsed out.
reviews.title: Big Iberostar Fan

reviews.text: Stayed at Iberostar Bavaro and overall I was delighted. Here are the highlights and a couple of caveats.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice with a couple of Caveats

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: Outstanding. True 5 star territory. The variety and freshness from MULTIPLE buffets and a la carte restaurants was outstanding. Christmas dinner?... LOBSTERFEST !! The food here is vastly superior to any all inclusive I have visited.
reviews.title: Lovely winter get-away

reviews.text: Grounds: Gorgeous... two story townhouses nestled in a beautiful coconut grove. They had little LED lights affixed on plam trees and plants all over the property. At night the effect was romantic and calming... simply lovely. The lobby bars and pool area facilities are exemplary and kept spotless.
reviews.title: Iberostar Bavaro: An Obvjective Review

reviews.text: Rooms: Average. Bed was a bit soft for my liking and on a couple of mornings the resort struggled to provide sufficient hot water to the the rooms. However, the room was clean and the maid service was excellent.
reviews.title: "PERFECT WEDDING 6th December 2008"

reviews.text: Ambiance: Family friendly resort with a lot of kids running around. Don't come here if you want an "adult only" atmosphere. Pools were average - nothing special but clean and cool.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable; a few improvements needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from Staying at the Iberostar Bavaro. Two years ago we stayed at Riu Palace just down the beach and we had geat time and a friend recommended to stay at an Iberostar. I am so glad we followed her recommendation. Two weeks before we got there I emailed them and told them it was our anniversary and could we have a room close to the beach. Not only did we get a room right on the beach, but it was also right next to the pool. Room 2336. We couldn't have asked for a better location!
reviews.title: Bavaro excellence - September 28th, 2008

reviews.text: Our room was beautiful. We found out how to turn down the air conditioning, the dial was hidden. Yes, it was a little bit musty, but everyone who has been to the Carribean knows this is very common. The only thing is I was disappointed in the tv channels. We had peacocks on our patio.
reviews.title: Can't say enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the buffet was great. There was a different main coarse each night and there was plenty of choices. The pickles were to die for! We had lobster on Friday night and it was unlimited. Felix, our waiter most the nights, always had my champagne ready for me. The Japaneze was very good. We canceled our Gourmet, but I wish we hadn't. Everyone said it was the best!
reviews.title: Love the Bavaro - my 2nd time around too!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Broadway show at night was very good, the rest were just ok.
reviews.title: amazing beach

reviews.text: The drinks were much larger than the Riu's, so you didn't have to ask for 2 at a time.
reviews.title: OMG this hotel was amazing.!

reviews.text: We visited the Iberostar Bavaro from November 6 to 21, 2007 for our wedding. I am 23 years old and my husband 24. We had 42 guests ranging from 6 months in age to 76 years. The resort had something for everyone and catered to all of our guests. EVERYTHING about the resort was amazing and I don't understand how people can complain about the Bavaro. Not only did we have to find a nice resort to have our wedding, we also needed to take our guests into consideration and find somewhere where everyone could be happy. I didn't hear one complaint from anyone that came along, and we all had a great time. Of course I had expectations from the resort as far as meeting all of our guests' needs, and the hotel staff went above and beyond what I could have asked for. There were a few people with upset stomaches on occasion, but when you mix a lot of drinking, hot sun, and foreign food, this is sort of expected. Definitely nothing serious.
reviews.title: Perfect wedding destination! Could not have asked for more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as the wedding itself, my husband and I were extremely impressed with everything! Raiza, our wedding coordinator, had been in contact with us for the year leading up to our trip and assured us that everything would be wonderful. I am a real planner so it was very difficult to put your entire wedding day into someone else's hands thousands of miles away. The morning after we arrived we had a call to our room from the front desk asking us to stop by so we could meet with Raiza. My husband showed up in his bathing trunks, drink in hand, straight out of the pool, and we went over the very simple details for the wedding day. It could not have been any easier! We were in and out in a half hour with all of our tropical flowers picked, our location confirmed and a reasonable bill. Seriously, the pre-wedding preparation while we were down there took about an hour in total. We chose to have a religious ceremony so we made it a little more diificult for ourselves prior to leaving (with the marriage prep, documents, etc) but it was worth it. The wedding day was absolutley perfect, just as Raiza promised! I was so impressed how everything came together and there was nothing to worry about AT ALL! After getting married here, I would never do it any other way.
reviews.title: Fabulous time at the Iberostar

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this resort to anyone of any age. Our two weeks here were amazing and I honestly do not have one single complaint. For any potential brides and grooms, please email me if you want any additinal information about the wedding. I would love to share all the details!
reviews.title: Had a pretty good time over-all at the Bavaro

reviews.text: We will definitely be back to the Iberostar Bavaro. (My husabnd does not want to even try anywhere else after being here!) If you decide to go, you will have a great time. I Promise!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had another great stay at the Iberostar Bavaro for 7 days. This was our second trip to the resort and it was a wonderful as the first. Our room was very nice with a king size bed and had just been renovated. We left $2 tips every day for the maid with a list of beverage replenishments and she always left what we ordered. They are still renovating several units as they were during our first stay in April. I did not notice any musty smell but brought along a candle and some glade plug ins just in case. I also packed a night light for the bathroom which was a good idea so that I could see at night. The construction was on the other side of the resort(closer to the flea market) and we did hear the pile driver on occasion when we were at the beach, but never in our room.
reviews.title: "Loved the Iberostar Bavero...Long Honest review"

likes.liked: — The beautiful water, beach and our lovely suite

reviews.title: Would not go back
reviews.text: We visited the resort in mid-March with a group of seven. One person in our group recommended the resort, but you have to take recommendations with a grain of salt - it depends on the person's perspective.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been on four Sandal's vacations and loved everything about them. Good food, top shelf liquor, friendly and attentive staff - to name just a few of the reasons that Sandal's is superior in every way to Iberostar.
reviews.title: Hola--This is the best vacation we have had in years.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds and common area buildings were nice. The rooms were musty because the A/C is on a motion sensor. Unfortunately, so is the refrigerator, so don't expect a cold drink unless it's first thing in the morning. They tell you not to drink the tap water, but then only provide four bottles of water (and only restock the fridge every other day). The bed is not comfortable and the pillows are about 2 inches thick.
reviews.title: Fabulous Getaway!!!

reviews.text: The pool water was filthy by the swim-up bar - hair, debris, straws, you name it - floating around. The rest of the pool was fine. They have a kiddie pool, but don't enforce the use, so diapered children were allowed in the main pool.
reviews.title: wonderful spring break

reviews.text: The food was average at best. You could always find something to eat that was good, but forget about a variety of delicious food. Sit-down restaurant reservations were based on the number of nights you were staying, so you are forced to eat at the buffet - whether you like it or not. Even though they have empty seats in the restaurants, they still won't let you in. It's not exactly what I'd call all inclusive.
reviews.title: Great Family Time - Tips for Parents

likes.liked: — Pool that is appropriate for children

reviews.text: We had an absolutely wonderful time! The employees were great! We have never been pampered at a resort like this. The Buffet was wonderful and all the other restaurants were wonderful. The Carribean is beautiful on this side of the D.R. We will be back year after year! Our stay... 12/4/2006 - 12/11/2006
reviews.title: Pampered by everyone-Fantastic food!

likes.liked: — size of rooms, cleanliness, friendliness of ALL the employees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time here. I won't repeat much of what has been said in other reviews, but will add a few pieces of advice.
reviews.title: Great Place - Few Bits of Advice

reviews.text: Send the hotel an email prior to your trip specifying what sort of room you want. I did not do this since every other all-inclusive resort I have been to determines your room at the time you are checking in. I always have been able to specify in person. THis resort had rooms already assigned with most paperwork alread y done. I was travelling with my parents so needed to make changes so that we could be located together. We got a great location but not a renovated room. While the room was good, it wasn't great. Things kept breaking (although they would fix them promptly), the bed wasn't in the best shape, and the bathtub/shower combo had an inadequate curtain so you had to be careful not to flood the room.
reviews.title: Oh so wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was great. They did a wonderful job on the buffet. I loved the Mediterranean restaurant.
reviews.title: beautiful atmosphere, food mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did find a marked difference at the other 2 sister resorts. They were more crowded, lines at the bars, drinks were smaller. I was glad to be at the Bavaro.
reviews.title: Iberostar Bavaro ~ Amazing Resort, Abssolute Paradise!

likes.liked: — Everything! This is the such an incredible resort!

reviews.text: Nice and clean with beautiful pool and beaches. Negatives were construction going on next door that was very loud. The food was below average and the drinks were watered down. The Japanese restaurant was very good. There were not enough lounge chairs around the pool for quality sun space. Leaving the resort seemed very scary as the surrounding area all the way to the airport was very bad. We had a bag with valuables disappear from our room and guest services did not seem very interested in helping. I would recommend using the safe. Not a good destination for singles.
reviews.title: Good, but not great.

likes.liked: — Overall environment was nice and relaxing.

reviews.text: This is our second return trip to the Iberostar Bavaro. We got married there last November (2006) and had 30 guests, this year 20 returned with us. The beaches are fabulous. The staff is magnificent, best service I have ever experienced. Tip: bring trinkets for the maid, waiters, and bar staff (nail polish, t shirts, hats, jewlery) They appreciate it so much, and it is studd you have laying around for years that you will never use. Food is great, the Mediteraenean and Gourmet are tops! Pools are terrific, entertainment is top notch! You will not regret your stay. We plan on returning yearly! We even got free rum, flowers, a private cocktail party, and champagne for being return guests. Just let them know at the front desk! You will be thrilled if you choose this resort. Any bad reveiws you read are from overly picky, spoiled travelers who have never left the states, and expect the food and language to be exactly the same. No one got sick...everyone is returning next year. TRUST ME< YOU WILL LOVE IT!
reviews.title: Another wonderful trip!!!!!!
Love this place!!
reviews.text: We first stayed at the Iberostar Bavaro in 2000 with our 2 teenage boys-, 13 and 18. We never once felt that they were unsafe if they were out of our sight. The 3 hotels linked gave them a chance to hang out with other kids and never leave the compound. We have tried other resorts as a couple since then and always seem to be disappointed because we compare them to the Bavaro. This year I said, lets go back to the Bavaro or I'd rather stay at home! We again had the best vacation since our last trip there. The food is wonderful, the staff is very friendly, helpful and very much wants to make your stay a time to remember. The beach and pool are kept spotless and the best snorkeling is actually right off the beach in front of the Bavaro! There is a small reef out there and if you bring bread from the buffet they come out. Fish up to 2 feel long and brilliantly colored, all without signing up for a snorkel adventure. We are completely sold on the Bavaro and will go there every year from now on .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just returned from a great week at bavaro. i will start by saying that i booked everything myself (didn't use a travel company.) contacted the airline, transfer company, and hotel all myself. i was pretty nervous about this after i booked it and was reading how just about everyone else on trip advisor used apple, funjet, etc. but, everything went very smoothly. i'm not saying you shouldn't use a travel company, but if you have booked independently like i did, don't worry--hopefully your trip will go like mine and have no bumps in the road.
reviews.title: good, relaxing time

reviews.text: the aiport arrival went smoothly. just follow the crowd, it is pretty self explanitory. we used the silva transfer company, and they were great. very dependable. did everything just the way they said they would.
reviews.title: A brilliant place for kicking back!

likes.disliked: — Umm...nothing. It is a brilliant place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our trip through Apple Vacations and stayed December 2 through December 9. I wouldn't travel without booking with Apple. They had reps waiting for us at the airport when we arrived to take us to our bus and there were 2 reps available every day at our resort.
reviews.title: We're spoiled!

reviews.text: When we arrived at our resort we were greeted with a drink and directed to the lobby bar as our room wasn't quite ready. We arrived at 2 and check in wasn't until 3 but they got our room ready so we could get settled and be ready for orientation at 5. Orientation was lead by Cesar from Apple who told us what to watch out for and times he would be available for any questions. The only complaint we had was that when we booked our trip they gave us a list of activities such as parasailing, snorkeling, wind surfing that are available. What they don't tell you is that your insurance doesn't cover you for all of those activities because some aren't safe. Make sure you book your excursions with the resort and not with people selling them on the beach. We were even offered a free boat ride if we checked out a new resort down the beach called Cayenna. Beware of this...they gave us a ride there and left us and then the people at Cayenna hounded us to buy a travel package with them. STICK WITH YOUR RESORT!
reviews.title: Good But Not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked into our room we were amazed! We were greeted with a plate of fruit and bottle of rum since it was our honeymoon. The room was spotless and didn't smell musty like alot of reviews say. We did bring candles just in case but left them for the maid. There is no need for packing towels. Your towels in the room are replaced everyday and they also provide you with beach/pool towels.
reviews.title: Great time at the IB Bavaro!

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds, great staff, comfy bed!
likes.disliked: — Very big, you could get lost if you've had too much to drink!

reviews.text: The resort was decorated for Christmas and everything was well taken care of. The pool and beach were cleaned thoroughly every night. The ocean was gorgeous and perfect for swimming! Everyone was very friendly and eager to please. We found that tipping the bartenders a dollar or so for each round of drinks got us top of the line service. They saved us seats at the bar or would serve us first and gave us extra alcohol in our drinks.
reviews.title: Loved the Decor

reviews.text: Since we stayed 7 nights we got to make 3 reservations. We went with the Mediterranean, Steak House and the Japanese Restaurant. The Japanese was by far our favorite. Everything was good though...even the buffets had a great variety. We were very pleased. We checked out a couple restaurants at other resorts that we had access to. The Star Rock Cafe was a fun atomosphere with more Americanized food. We played darts and pool there. Fun times!
reviews.title: Disappointing stay from Dec 20-27, 2007
Trips with Sunquest - beware
reviews.text: Was at Iberostar feb 16-23 2009.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally pretty good. The food was ok, but the beef was not the best. The Asian restaurant was supprisingly good. Staff is excellent, very friendly.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Resort with Something For Everyone

reviews.text: Now about Sunquest - We booked a trip on the Carribean Festival on the endorsement of "Daniel", who made a number of claims about the trip. Take it all with a grain of salt. We had a terrible trip. When we complained we were greated with evasiveness and false promises. Despite his claim to holding a degree in English, his grammer is lacking. Specifically the difference between an apology and a justification. He even was too afraid to speak to one of the other unhappy guests and ducked out the back door rather than facing up to her
reviews.title: Loved Iberostar Bavaro!

reviews.text: At the end of a wasted day spent largely standing around waiting in line, we were given back $10 on a trip costing about $100. Still, he continues to state "never had a complaint" when trying to flog this trip.
reviews.title: A lovely family vacation

reviews.text: Caveat emptor is all I can say.
reviews.title: Large property and very nice!!!

reviews.text: I've stayed at a lot of hotels in my time because I travel alot, but this was my first stay at an all-inclusive. Iberostar Bavaro had really good ratings on TripAdvisor and I had a friend that stayed here the year before, so it seemed like a sure thing. Initially, the room aesthetic was a little underwhelming, but once you realize the vibe of the resort is very bungalo-ish, old colonial, you learn to appreciate it. The grounds themselves are beautiful, with tons of fruits trees (mango, lemons, etc.) and live ducks and flamingos roaming the grounds. The food is pretty basic since they have to appeal to all nationalities, but we did have a wonderful meal at the French a la carte restaurant. By far, the BEST meal we had in our 5 day stay. The entertainment staff were absolutely wonderful. Aside from being incredibly entertaining and responsive, the speak multiple languages to communicate with guests all over the world. The nightly performances either made you laugh in hysterics or boogie down with the live band as they jam to hits from the 70s and 80s. My friend and I both agreed that it was the entertainment staff that made this resort a must visit and they are the reason we would likely return.
reviews.title: Entertainment Staff Make This Resort A Must Visit

reviews.text: As a side note, you gain access to the Iberostar Dominicana and Punta Cana when you stay at the Bavaro, but you can't go to the Grand Bavaro. In addition, we met several multi-year return guests that stayed at the Grand Bavaro for the first time (since it opened earlier this year) and they found the guests at GB were pretentious and snooty and kept to themselves, so they spent the bulk of their time at the fun properties (Bavaro-Dominicana-Punta Cana).
reviews.title: Slight disappointment, especially food wise (considering AI)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all these reviews we picked up Iberostar Bavaro as our holiday destination. We hoped to have all this great food, fun and perfect service.
reviews.title: Two years in a row and it was 100% awesome!

reviews.text: Unfortunately not everything was that perfect.
reviews.title: Great Value -Wonderful Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's start with the biggest disappointment - food.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: A whole group of us went down to escape the January weather--the weather there was truly wonderful--in the 80's and sunny....Most of us stayed at the Bavaro and a few were at the Dominicana....We were at the Bavaro and found the rooms to be nice size...we had people in and had plenty of room...one thing to take to heart--do not bring food of any kind back to your room--they tell you this--and do not do it....you will be visited by little ants if you do....otherwise we had none....
reviews.title: Truly Paradise!
Great Vacation!
reviews.text: The beach was heavenly, soft sugary sand and plenty of little cabanas to sit under...Take a walk down the beach and haggle with the guys...some are really nice guys and others are not...I bought from the nice ones and got a fair price...do not overpay since they love to negotiate...We found the bottom dollar on coffee was 4.00.

The food was great and plenty of it everywhere...the ice cream by the beach(chocolate chip) was my favorite....The specialty restaurants we went to were very good....Japanese was great(and my hubby does not even like Japanese but liked it) and the Gourmet Restaurant was wonderful--wish we had went there twice...
reviews.title: Liked it so much, it was our 2nd time there

reviews.text: The friendliness of the people was noteworthy when you compare to other vacation spots...I tipped our maid a couple of bucks per day and she had fun trying to teach me some Spanish....I even wrote Spanish on her note every day...
reviews.title: Bavaro is great
Fantastice Experience at Bavaro Suites !
reviews.text: And if you go on the Outback Safari Tour(I highly recommend it and be prepared for potholes...)be sure you take some kids crayons, markers, notebooks, pencils, stickers etc...since they stop at a couple of schools and that is how the survive....very poor in the outback country....Our guide was fantastic and even shared a pic of his little one....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Iberostar Bavaro for our honeymoon because of all of the fantastic reviews we read about the resort. For the most part it did live up to our expectations.
reviews.title: Great Beaches and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the second time we booked our trip through apple vacations and were very pleased with the service we received. Make sure you have used the restroom prior to getting off the plane. The plane's restrooms seem immaculate compared to the ones in the arrival area of the airport. There is not air conditioning in the arrival side of the airport so make sure you dress in layers. (There is air conditioning in the departure side once you get past the restaurants) Upon arrival into the airport your picture is taken with two women dressed in native Dominican dresses. You can buy the picture upon departure. From there you pay a $10 "tourist" fee- be sure to have your passport ready. Once getting your bags dodge the swarm of men that will try to help you with you baggage. (They expect large tips) Make your way to your tour company's counter to find out which bus will transport you to your hotel.
reviews.title: Really Relaxing
Too much smoking
reviews.text: The trip from the airport to the resort was fairly short, approx 30 min, compared to the other resort I stayed at on the island. However the freeway that they are constructing doesn't seem any more complete than it did several years ago when I visited. The busses are air conditioned, a much welcomed break from the heat. Dominican drivers don't really follow any traffic laws so brace yourself for a never ending game of chicken most of the way to the resort.

We arrived at our resort at about 1:00. Check in was very quick and we were greeted with two bahama mama's to cool us down. We were a little disappointed to see so much construction occurring at the resort during our stay. Upon talking to several people, during low seasons the resorts will perform their renovations. Hence the lower pricing. Luckily most of the work was done at night so we didn't really notice much noise from it other than the main lobby.
reviews.title: Iberostar Bavaro is First Rate!!

reviews.text: Our room was very spacious. We had a second floor suite with a king size bed. We never heard any noise from any of the other units in the building. The room was decorated with fresh cut flowers and was kept very clean. We did notice ants on the bathroom counter periodically throughout our stay. We realized that many times these would come from the fresh flowers that were put out. The refrigerator was not working when we arrived so we did have to wait almost an hour for it to be repaired. Towels were restocked daily and the room was kept very clean by the staff.
reviews.title: Decent Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed a fabulous honeymoon! We stayed at the resort from October 12-19. We booked through Apple Vacations and the process could not have been been any smoother. We always felt like we had someone there for us in case of any issues. I have been to may islands and I must say that with combined beauty and value the Dominican Republican is the best! The room was great with the musty odor being noticeable but not overpowering. I read about that on this site beforehand and brought a bath and body works mini room freshner with me.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool, swim-up bar, and the beach were the best!! We also loved the personalities of the bartenders that worked at the lobby bar. The food far exceeded my expectations. I felt that everything was fresh and the variety was impressive. When we arrived we were only guaranteed 3 reservations for dinner during a 7 night stay but each afternoon around 3:00pm we would check with the concierge to see if any reservations cancelled and we were able to book restaruants for 5 of our 7 nights. My husband loved the Cajun restaurant and my favorite was the Japanese restaurant. I thought the sushi and tempura were fabulous. With the dinner buffet, on Friday nights they have lobster and I thought it was delicous! We also ordered room service several days and while the menu was limited, we ordered the chicken nuggets each time and they really were delicious. We always received our food within 15-20 minutes of calling.
reviews.title: Iberostar Bavaro - Great, Relaxing, Will Return

likes.liked: — Suites at Bavaro were spacious, with sleeping area, living area and outdoor private patio
likes.disliked: — A/C controls were not as specific as one might expect

reviews.text: The best tip we could have received would be to bring a lot of $1 and $2 dollar bills. We brought $75 in small bills and for the week we probably could have used about $100-$125. We tipped the housekeeper $2 daily, at the bar we would give $1 after each round of drinks, and we would tip $3-$5 for the formal dinners in the restaurant and $1-$2 for the buffets. Americans were in the minority at the resort- there were a lot of German, French, English, and Spanish-speaking guests and typically European countries do not tip. You never felt like you had to tip and it was always so appreciated.
reviews.title: Fantastic Family Holiday

likes.liked: — Service and constant attention to surroundingsto keep your holiday experience perfect.

reviews.text: We did two excursions which included the Bavaro Splash which was the mini speed boats and it was a lot of fun. We also did a dune buggy/horseback ride which was great but there were so many people in our group that we had to go pretty slow and stay in a line. If any of you decide to do the dune buggy or ATV excursions, bring a bandanna with you from home. There is a lot of dust//manure that flys up and on-site the place charges us $5 per bandana or 2 for $8. Another reason to take small bills- We only had a $10 bill and were told that they do not have singles even though I saw her accept several $1 bills! When you are outside of the resort you really do need exact change or you may find yourself short-changed.
reviews.title: Great week at the bavaro

reviews.text: Overall- great experience, great hotel, loved it and cannot wait to go back!
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I booked our trip on 4/13 through our travel agent based on the recommendation of a friend who went during Christmas week. We were left on our own upon leaving the plane & trying to locate the correct transfer vehicle from the airport to the hotel.We were taken to the wrong van, several minutes later, we were brought to the correct one. It was all quite confusing & chaotic especially since we did not speak Spanish & no one was interested in speaking English! We listened to very loud rap music during the 30-40 minute drive to the resort. Upon check in,we were given a room w/ 2 double beds. I basically begged for a king & our request was granted when we rechecked after returning from lunch. No other requests for room accommodation were made-no ocean view, no non-smoking room.The room was dark, musty & there was no control as to the comfort level of the air conditioning. The ceiling fan over the bed was either too slow(ineffective) or too fast(causing a huge draft on you while you slept). The oversize shower stall was nice, however, there was a large collection of hair on the drain & small spiders in the corner. My husband stepped on a small piece of glass that was on the bedside throw rug. The room safe did not work. The room refrigerator was not cold so of course, the drinks were not. Finally, three people showed up simultaneously to correct these various problems after I made several continuous calls to the front desk, but alas, no one spoke English, so I spent another 15 minutes on the phone with the front desk reexplaining the problems to them while they then interpreted to the appropriate personnel. We went to the pool to the swim up bar. At 3:00pm, the pool was filled with debris, leaves, dirt, hair etc, & there was several long hairs on the bar where we sat. The drinks both alcoholic and nonalcoholic were horrible @ best. One can make a better pina colada using a grocery store mix. There was either minimal alcohol or watered down drinks which is why there probably were not any out of control, inebriated people there!! The food was average/below average for a "resort". At any of the buffets,indoors or out, it was not uncommon to see flies randomly landing here & there on all the food. There was little in the way of American food as we know it. The hamburg tasted very odd. The buffet was very different style food, jellied, spicy,or pickled. Even the desserts were not worth the calories. The fresh fruits were delicious, but we ate too many carbs due to the lack of options. Even at breakfast, the french toast & waffles were soggy. The steaks & grilled chicken at the outdoor luncheon grill was excellent & the cheese pizza was surprisingly good. The gourmet restaurants were delicious, but you are only allowed to go to them based on the number of nights you are staying at the resort-ie, a 4 night stay allows you to make a one night reservation for one of the restaurants. People from the USA were the friendliest of the tourists, the others were rude & didn't mind if you knew it. Was there anything good about our trip?? YES! The weather was incredible-no humidity, sunny & in the 80's. The ocean was an enormous pool of layers of turquoise & warm. You did have to put a towel on your chair by 6:30-7:00am if you wanted a"hut" to be out of the sun which was rather intense. I had 2 spa body wraps & two 30 minute back/shoulder massages all for the price of what I have paid at some resorts for just 1 massage! A great bargain. The most disconcerting thing that occurred was that on the morning we left, we went to breakfast, leaving our 2 checked luggage bags outside our door as instructed, placed the do not disturb sign on the door, closed the curtains & went to breakfast. My husband left a $10 bill on the table as a tip for our stay. When we returned, our room was the way we left it with one exception-the money was gone & so was my makeup bag, brushes, etc. We already had one experience w/ leaving 2 facecloths in a drawer so we would have extras and later finding them gone, obviously someone had gone through our things. We did file a report, but could not see it through, we had to get to the front of the resort to be picked up for the airport. The bus was 45 mins late & no one kept us informed as to the delay. We got to the airport & wanted to purchase the photo they took of us when we entered the airport upon our arrival & they could not find it nor did they go out of their way to locate it. VERY FRUSTRATING!!!!
reviews.title: Would not return

likes.liked: — Beautiful ocean & climate, grounds are pretty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (a middle-aged couple, one American, one Brit) had a wonderful stay at the Iberostar Punta Cana/Dominicana from April 6th through the 14th. The room was spacious and comfortable, and we were completely satisfied with the service and the meals. The staff was genuinely friendly and greeted us with a smile and an “Hola” everywhere we went.
reviews.title: A fantastic week!

reviews.text: Our room had two very comfortable (firm-ish) beds, a sofa and table, a TV with enough stations to keep us entertained during the few minutes we were actually in the room, and a mini-bar which was filled every day. The bathroom was spacious, clean, and the shower worked just fine. We had control of the temperature of the room, meaning that we could turn the air conditioner on and off as we saw fit. The balcony had a table and chairs, as well as a small clothesline to hang up our wet things. It was well cleaned every day, and our cleaning lady always decorated our sink with flowers from the garden.
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.text: The food was varied and catered to both American and European appetites. The breakfast buffet had everything from bacon and eggs to donuts and croissants, as well as oatmeal, yogurt and granola for the health-conscious. There was also a large variety of cheese and cold cuts, hot and cold vegetables, and (my favorite!), lots of local fruit. Freshly-made juices topped it all off. For lunch and dinner, there was again a huge choice of foods, both hot and cold. Sure, you could get things like hot dogs, hamburgers and pizza, but really, folks, you can eat those at home. Why not try something different? The fish was lovely and there was usually some sort of roasted meat in the evening. There were plenty of salads and veggies, including some local vegetables that I hadn’t seen before. I never ate the same thing twice, and I liked nearly everything I tried.
reviews.title: Wouldn't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at two of the restaurants—the tropical and the oriental ones. The oriental was quite good, but I found the regular buffet to be better than the tropical restaurant. Others we spoke to during our trip felt the same.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

likes.liked: — The beach and the European people

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for the week of Thanksgiving with friends. We have traveled many times to Mexico and Jamiaca. We have had much better experiences there.
reviews.title: No bravo for Bavaro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will try to be a simple as I can.
reviews.title: Awesome honeymoon

reviews.text: DR: Like any other island.
reviews.title: so so experience

reviews.text: Iberostar: Really disapointed me. I have been to others, and they were so nice. This one was awful.
reviews.title: Good bargain, but not a 4 star resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach: Great. This is the one shining spot for this resort. Lots of huts, good sand and surf. Green waters. Water was warm.
reviews.title: AWESOME VACATION!!!!

reviews.text: I have traveled the world, i have seen many things. It is important to say that this truly was the best experience i have ever had. iberostar bavaro punta cana was the most memorable vacation I have ever been on. There is so much to do, and the staff was icredible. They welcome you with such a warm greeting and you truly feel like you are at home. The staff at Disney World at first are kind to you, and then slack off as if they dont want to be there. At Iberostar Bavaro it is their home. They are so kind, and not to mention very talented. Some of the best dancers i have ever seen are right there at that fantastic resort. I have never been to a beach party at one in the morning, or scuba dived in a pool until this trip. Every thing was incredible. I was a fan of the dancing that took place wherever you walked.
