I truly appreciated the dedicated men and women who took the extra minutes to keep up the resort grounds ultimately making it the nicest and cleanest. I strongly recommend this resort. It is child friendly, and suitable for all ages with so much to do if you want to be active, or a beach if you just want to relax and enjoy the famous Coco Loco. Oh yea, and dont forget about the all inclusive plan that comes with the hotel, i guess i forgot to mention that little detail. This makes the resort 100 times better. It is a relief to not carry a cell phone around, or money, and not know the time. It is without a doubt the best vacation to take your family, or a loved one on. Words cant even explain my stay at the Iberostar Bavaro.
reviews.title: Best Vacation Ive ever had

reviews.text: My friends and I just got back from the Iberostar Bavaro, and we had an AMAZING time! Overall, we concluded that our stay was definitely a bargain, considering how much it costs for all-inclusives in other Caribbean locations like Aruba, Jamaica, etc. We would have to spend hundreds of dollars more for the same level of service elsewhere. The D.R. is becoming more popular, so I'm expecting that prices will increase once people realize how great it is!
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing time!! If there's a negative, it's that I had to come home!

likes.disliked: — Reservations fill up too quickly at the restaurants

reviews.title: Wonderful week
reviews.text: Let me start by saying that the grounds of this resort are gorgeous! Not my words nor even photos can not do it justice. It's perfect! Very green, very lush, and there are peacocks everywhere... and I mean everywhere! CLEAN, CLEAN, CLEAN.... I think it's amazing how clean they even keep the bathrooms by the pool and in the lobby! There are not many resorts in the US that keep their facilities as clean as the Iberostar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the staff, they are some of the friendliest and most accomodating I've experienced in my travels. If you try to speak Spanish, they love you even more. They are always smiling, particularly the male staff. The bartenders at the pool bar are great... say hola to Cecilio and Freimy for me! They love to get you to try their shots. (They may even do one with you! But on the down low)
reviews.title: Loved the Iberostar Bavaro!!!!

likes.liked: — The gorgeous beaches, the amazing food, and the drinks

reviews.text: The food is impressive. Sometimes you hear about how the food quality is not that great at all-inclusives, but I was pleasantly surprised. Of course, when you stay at a resort for 5+ days, the food at the buffet will get repetitive. But it's a good quality, and it has EVERYTHING. Prepare to indulge... like cheros for breakfast! I was a bit disappointed in the fresh fruit. I did not think it was outstanding, just fair. For specialty restaurants try the Gourmet (amazing Lobster salad and beef tenderloin) and the Japanese (the Tepankayi was awesome, sushi was just ok). We wanted to try the Mexican but could not get a reservation. I'd suggest making all of your reservations for your trip as soon as you check in. The times fill up quickly, particularly at the better restaurants.
reviews.title: Best resort in puna cana

likes.liked: — clean, modern very spacious newly renovated
likes.disliked: — glass door on shower too short water all over floor.

reviews.text: My sister, our husbands and children (ages 5 & 9) visited the Bavaro from 4/8-4/14.
reviews.title: Wanted to stay longer!

reviews.text: As an avid reader of trip advisor, I was sure to check as many reviews of the Bavaro before we booked it. I can definitely say people were right about how beautiful the resort is. It is lush with peacocks, flamingos, etc. Prior to leaving for the Bavaro, our travel agent put in a request for us to have 2 rooms close to eachother and near the beach/pool. Both requests were fulfilled and we were very happy with the accomodations (we were in rooms 2395 & 2396, very close to the pool/beach). The rooms are very nice, just don't leave any food or drinks in your room or they will be covered in a very short time with little black bugs, as we found out. We did tip housekeeping everyday, but didn't really get any special treatment. I did like the fact that when I went to my room when housekeeping was there, they were putting clean sheets on the beds, not just making the beds.
reviews.title: Bravo Bavaro
Iberostar Bavaro
reviews.text: The beach and pools are both great, plenty of room at both. There are some nice small reefs within swimming distance of the beach that we took bread out to and fed the fish. The kids loved this, but be aware that some of the fish were pretty big and might scare small children, as it did my 5 year old! If you stay to the left of the beach where the banana boats leave from, there are less rocks and coral in the water than to the right side where it was hard to swim and stand. The banana boat was a lot of fun, just advise the boat driver not to go too fast with little ones (we were thrown off 3 times). We did visit the tents (shops) at the end of the beach to buy jewelry and get the kid's hair breaded. The price for the hair braiding was half of what we were quoted at the resort. There are only 2 people that do the hair breading at the resort, versus 5 at the beach shops. At the resort you had to make an appointment, at the beach you did not.

Drinks and food were plentiful, but the local alcohol is disgusting. Ask for name brand alcohol if available (it is not at every bar). I really liked the banana mamas and frozen lemonade (with Stoli vodka), but the rest of the frozen drinks were very sweet. We made reservations at four of the specialty restaurants, even though we were told we could only make 3 reservations. The Japanese and the steak house were both very good. The Jambalaya was ok as well as the other restaurant at the Dominicana we went to (can't remember the name). We did tip everywhere we went because the workers do work hard. Knowing some Spanish is helpful, but if one person doesn't understand you, try asking another.
reviews.title: Wonderful Time with the Family
Beautiful Views!!
reviews.text: The weather was very nice, not humid, but hot. We did have one full day of rain, but we still went snorkeling and swimming (beware of very slippery walkways when they are wet). The star friends did their best to entertain people during the bad weather. My daughter went to the kids club for a few hours and had a good time. The staff is very friendly and attentive to the children, unlike some other resorts we have visited. Also, go to the evening shows, the star friends do their best to keep you entertained.

The best thing about Iberostar are its incredibly dedicated and friendly employees. Next, the subtropical plantings and multitude of peacocks make for a lush, humid and quite colourful setting. A great deal of care involves maintainance of the physical plant, and it is flawless.
reviews.title: Bad food and drink...and lots of cream...spoiled a great trip

likes.liked: — Great Sea, Sand, Sun, Pools and employees

reviews.title: Good hotel; when not so many guests are from America and Kanada
reviews.text: While there are activities such as snorkling, tennis, shopping, and group exercise by the immense pool, the main components of a tirp to Bavaro are Sun, Sea, Relaxation, swimming and eating, which may be done ad nauseum practically 24 hours a day. Drinks, including alcohol, are free, which is nice for hydration, and suprisingly, I didn't see anyone passed out around the bar.

reviews.title: Nothing you can put into words will reach 50% of the real thing.
reviews.text: American-style food is almost non-existant; every dish is tempered by creams, jellies and what my daughter refers to as "wilted cheese." Many items are pickled inexplicably, and may have been recovered from a nearby shipwreck. :)....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you simply want to relax in a free-form atmosphere, this is a great place. However, we spent the first 2 plus hours searching for a room that didn't smell of mold. Accomodations are on par with an American budget hotel that needs renovation and an air purification system. The better sleep arrangements would be in "pods" near the pool, which leads to a commodious beach. A short walk connects everything in the Bavaro complex.
reviews.title: brilliant!!

likes.liked: — very big,clean and comfy with great views

reviews.text: Note: Speaking Spanish will help you communicate with employees and in understanding television programs. NO clocks, radios, or turndown service is available as far as I know. Its an all-inclusive. We traveled via American Air to Miami....then a 4hr layover before a four-hour flight to the Dominican republic. At the airport, expect antiquated (non-hip-hop) native music, and many employees looking for your euro or USD. Be careful as you would in any airport. This is a charming one, with thached roofs. Also, the trip from the airport to the beach is a lesson in harsh reality, and "the good life" of the beach is in harsh, direct contrast with the status of the local villages.
reviews.title: Our 1st trip and we plan to go back!

reviews.text: Have been to many IBerostar and wanted to try the Bavaro because we love this stretch of beach. Checkin was seamless! Rooms were ready and gorgeous Love the couch on the balcony! Bathroom setup is kind of strange. Larger sized people may have a problem! Food was plentiful, good selections and good tasting! Availability of pool seating was the most I had ever seen at any resort! No chair wars here! We were here for Superbowl and had Steak and Lobster with Football themed decorations at the Steakhouse by the pool! We were proud when people stood for the American anthem! Staff was friendly and service was great. Beloney, Hector and our housekeeper Milonis? deserve kudos! Grounds are gorgeous but still had scattered New Years eve decorations in the plants. Staff was great to transport us between the other resorts and fun! Loved our room location! We had 3 rooms - all 3 had multiple safe issues. One had air conditioning problems. One had no shower door or curtain and then that air conditioning unit leaked all over with water extending down to the lower level. Maintenance fixed the issue but left the occupants to clean the mess up and drape wet clothes all over to dry ! Apple rep was apologetic but IB manager offered nothing.
reviews.title: Almost great BUT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 05/13-05/19/2012, booked through Apple Vacations which included round-trip transfer. We had a wonderful time at the resort and are planning to go back in August. We were given Rm 2431 with a balcony facing the pool area. Room was spotless and well stocked with amenities. Although the room smelled a bit musty, we attributed that to the humidity in Punta Cana (same as other tropical destinations). The staff sprayed the draperies, bedding, and sofa with fabric freshener so that helped.
reviews.title: Wonderful time at the resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort has 5 specialty (Mediterranean, Japanese, Cajun, French, Steak), and 2 buffet-style restaurants. During our 6 nights stay, we ate all of our dinners in one of the specialty restaurants (except steak), and had breakfast and lunch at one of the two buffets. We had no problem getting dinner reservation; I was able to reserve on our first day there and enjoyed Japanese food on the first night (delicious, light-as-air tempura). I was able to book for 4 nights and was told to come back the next night to book the remaining days as only 3 future bookings are allowed at one time. The girl at the guest service desk was very helpful and answered all my questions with a smile and patience.
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon!

reviews.text: For the price paid per day, the value received was excellent. Food selections were plentiful and varied; quality of ingredients were good and fresh. We enjoyed all types of meats - chicken, steak, pork-chop, lamb, duck, and all types of seafood -shrimp, different types of fish, mussel, scallop, and lobster. For those reviewers who complained the restaurants did not serve food like they had at home, my question would be "why didn't you just stay home then?" Vacation is a time to enjoy different, and sometimes new, experiences. Unless the reviewers regularly dined on frozen entrees at home, I don't see how the varieties of food offered (including basic fares like pizza, pasta, hot dog, and hamburger) would not somehow make it on the "food from home" list. Yes they served pate on toast, but hey, even non-European like us love pate too!
reviews.title: Great family resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kudos to all Star Friends staff, they worked tirelessly from morning to night trying to entertain the guests and get them engaged. For those guests that enjoyed activities, they ranged from ping-pong tournament, dancing, archery, arm-wrestling, aerobic, volleyball, to egg-throwing contest. At night, the Star Friends staff put on different nightly shows which always started off with award presentation and slide shows of the day's activities. Then the staff would asked the guests to dance for a while before the show started. For those guests (like us) who just want to be observers and not participants, just tell the staff no thanks, and they were not pushy, they just graciously expressed their disappointment by making a sad face, said thank you, and went to the next guests. Keep in mind the entertainment is not a Broadway production, so if you are expecting Broadway quality, please go to NYC. All the Star Friends staff worked incredibly hard the whole day and always with the easy going, happy, friendly attitude while dealing with hundreds of guests. To us, they are "Superstar" Friends.
reviews.title: Not close to a 4.5 stars.

reviews.text: Hola... Just got back from our trip to Punta Cana, Iberostar Bavaro. We visited from December 10-17, 2006. This review is pretty lengthly and hope it will help someone. First I would like to disclose that I am a travel agent and was chose to stay at Iberostar Bavaro because they are in my opinion very consistent. booked this through TNT vacations. I was there to view a bunch of hotels and enjoy the resort while I was there. This resort is beautiful. But best of all was the staff! from reception, wait staff, bartenders, housekeeping, & most of all star friends. We started off by tipping about $1-$2 and received such amazing service by the 3rd day pretty much were giving $3-$5... Dominicans are such warm, family orientated people. I saw more employees talking w/ little kids, touching their hair, cutting their food.
reviews.title: Great choice...very happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never been to a caribbean island that had so many different travelers. I was surprised to see there was not a large amount of americans but mostly europeans.
reviews.title: I would not return to the Domincan Republic

reviews.text: There was alot of a mexican inspiration in the architecture & mainly the language. Reception, wait staff, star friends, etc.. spoke quite a bit of english. was not able to communicate very well w/ security, housekeeping, landscapers.
reviews.title: Great Vacation-Iberostar is great!

reviews.text: Power outages in Punta Cana are pretty frequent there. There was about 5 times we lost power for about :3-:5 min. There was a time for about :20min that we lost power at about 6:15pm.
reviews.title: what a holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in the room alone(husband was at the gym), and had just gotten out of the shower. It was so dark you could not see your hand in front of your face. I would recommend to bring along one of those little flashlights that can fit on your key chain.
reviews.title: Nothing spectacular

likes.disliked: — food and trip back and forth to airport

reviews.text: We stayed here in June of 2005. I know...this is a little overdue...
reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds!
Wonderful solo vacation
reviews.text: Beautiful grounds! This is probably the most beautiful resort we have EVER stayed at! Breakfast was exceptional, other meals were soso...although sushi was great! Children's activities were awesome and there was always something for the little ones...which was important, our group had 6 children!

Staff at the beach were great, staff in the lobby, not so great! Room was spacious but smelled like mildew and the air conditioner broke in the middle of the night. After a long battle over english or spanish, we were able to get it repaired (a few hours later).
reviews.title: Absolute Paradise!

likes.liked: — The beautiful beach and kid friendly pool area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would go back...everyone deserves a second chance!
reviews.title: April in Paradise

reviews.text: I went on vacation to the Iberostar Bavaro for 4 nights (4/17-4/21) by myself after a bad breakup. The sun, sand, beautiful water and peaceful surroundings were just what I needed. The facilities are well kept and tasteful, and the staff works hard to make everything enjoyable. It was enjoyable for me to see people of all ages enjoying the wonderful resort with their loved ones. Definitely a good representation of European vacationers, which was nice. Also fun were the many peacocks that live on the large property and provide entertainment and enhanced scenery!
reviews.title: Loved the IB Bavaro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently went to Punta Cana for our honeymoon. We wer originally scheduled to stay at Dreams, but since a road was flooded we were booked for one night at Iberostar Bavaro. The next day we went to Dreams and didn't like it. We paid some extra money to come back to Ibersotar Bavaro because we liked it so much!
reviews.title: THIS PLACE IS GREAT!!!

reviews.text: I'll try to be thorough so that this will be helpful for you - after all, if you are thinking about going to the Dominican, it is likely a big decision for you. To start with, the room was very nice, very clean, very comfortable and inviting. The staff: AWESOME! I would say that over 90% of the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The staff is a huge reason why we will return to this resort. As for the beach, it was beautiful! Soft, white sand with extremely pretty blue-green water and nice cabanas everywhere with some shade (in case you don't want to get burnt in the direct sunlight). Also, the pool is big and beautiful and has a very nice swim-up bar.
reviews.title: Beware of Sankies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food choices were abundant and very good. It is impossible to go hungry at this resort. After a few days of overindulging in drinks and food, we finally 'toned it down' for fear of gaining a ton of weight! :) One of my concerns regarding the resort was the issue of restaurant reservations: I was concerned that we only got a few guaranteed reservations during the stay. Don't let that concern you. The main buffet that is almost always open has soooo much good food that it is not a concern. In fact, this buffet is just as good if not better than some of the restaurants. I would recommend the Japanese restaurant and the French restaurant. The French restaurant is very elegant and very romantic. Even if you have never tried French food, you should love this place. Most of the restaurants will also have a 3-person band sing to you and they're very charming.
reviews.title: Bavaro is EXCELLENT!

reviews.text: One of the nice things we liked at the resort was the entertainment. Every night around 9:30 p.m. there is a stage performance next to the main bar and it is usually quite entertaining. Our favorite performance was a "Newlywed Game Show" that was hysterical!
reviews.title: Please, send management Mini-Disco clips

likes.liked: — Those daytime seating sofas that converted into nice size night time beds for kids
likes.disliked: — Walk ways get slippery for bare foot during/after rain

reviews.text: One thing we liked about the resort was that it had a European influence. There were plenty of French, German, American and Latin citizens. For the most part, most of the people that stayed there appeared to be classy and polite. Most of the children we saw appeared to be well-mannered. We met alot of very nice people there who we will remain friends with once we return from vacation. Also, we had alot of fun beach volleyball games. One nice thing about this resort is that it is fairly close to the airport, so it doesn't take very long to get there.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds, good food, extremely clean and well maintained
likes.disliked: — Musty smell in the room, lack of beach wait service

reviews.text: we stayed at the iberostar bavaro for 2 weeks on the 26/04/2012 and enjoyed it very much. Hotel and grounds beautiful staff work really hard keeping it clean. we found all members of staff from maids to bar staff very friendly and cant do enough for you. Really great for kids, my daughter loved the kids pool and mini disco. Plenty of food to choose from we really enjoyed the Rock Star Bar, service and food there fantastic. we have stayed in punta cana before but would definitly choose to come back to the iberostar bavaro again!!!!!
reviews.title: fantastic holiday definitly come back!!!
Amazing vacation, wonderful resort
reviews.text: My wife & I had a lovely vacation at this resort. George at the front desk and Alejandro from Guest Services were especially helpful. From the entertainment staff to the restaurant servers, everyone was really friendly and made us feel welcome. We requested a room close to the beach and was given room 2456, which is a short walk to the pool, Los Bohios, the poolside buffet restaurant and the beach. We did have some trouble when we went snorkeling. Our guide didn't speak any English & never spoke to the group at all. The staff took the boat out of the way to drop another employee off down the beach. I cut up my knee on some coral swimming in shallow water. There wasn't a first aid kit on the boat so I had to run over to the pharmacy afterwards for rubbing alcohol and band aids. The hair dryer in the hotel room only blew cold air. But other than that we had an enjoyable stay. A couple of quick notes: we thought the taxis and resort only took pesos but they do take U.S. dollars. Also, coming from the states we weren't sure if we would need a voltage adapter. As long as its a two- prong plug, you don't. Check out the Japanese restaurant Hashiru. It was delicious.The spa was incredible, great massages. The whole time my wife and I couldn't believe it was all inclusive. You will enjoy your stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon to the Iberostar Bavaro in Punta Cana. We loved the experience provided by the staff. Almost without exception, they are friendly, eager to help, and able to take care of your guest needs. It is possible to be almost continuously eating and drinking if you desire. They also have numerous programs throughout the day to keep you entertained if you need something to do besides relax on the beach. At night, there is a different show. Some of them are quite entertaining. I was always able to find something that I liked at the buffets and restaurants, though my wife rates the food at least one star lower than I did. She did feel like the quality of the food was better at the restaurants. You are guaranteed 3 reservations if you are staying for a week. It's largely an opportunity to eat in a smaller, quieter, atmosphere, and a nice break from the buffets.
reviews.title: Great vacation, great staff
AWESOME RESORT!!!!!!!!!!!!!! May 5 to May 12
reviews.text: At the Bavaro, you also have access to the Iberostar Punta Cana and Dominicana resorts. They offer a few different restaurants and nightlife options. My wife and I went over there a couple of times and felt like the staff, while still very friendly, was a cut below the staff at the Bavaro. I would highly recommend the Bavaro over the other two resorts.

I would like to make a recommendation to other Americans. Please learn a few basic words and phrases in Spanish. This is a Spanish speaking country, run by a company based in Spain. The staff speaks many different languages (and pretty well at that), but they also enjoy it when you can say a few phrases in Spanish. Remember, if you ask questions that they wouldn't be asked every day, you need to politely and patiently work with them to communicate. They are definitely eager to help you in any way possible. Once or twice, my wife and I observed some "ignorant American" behavior and it was embarrassing.
reviews.title: Nice Hot & Sunny Vacation!

reviews.text: great time had by all ,myself ,wife, and child where shall i start after a short 1/2 hour ride from the airport we were greeted by a nice cool drink at the lobby area where we recieved our stay package check in was 5 minutes tops ,bags were brought to our room within minutes beach and pool are wonderful and very very clean the room was very cozy no issues with the room at all, i read people had issues with the water and the rooms in general no issues here , maids cleaned up every day on time, use the safes they offer in the room being from new york u cant trust anyone lol the food hmm breakfast and lunch were great anything u want made to order, dinner was ok yes just ok im not going to complain about it because its not like the steak houses at home but the food was good no issues no illnesses, the water,, even though i didnt drink it they say its safe and clean but why take a chance drink bottled water the grounds are safe and extremly clean the flea market on the beach is nasty and the people there are annoying but i had no issues with them i just blew them off if i wasnt intrested over all a very very nice place ,safe ,clean ,and a wonderful caring staff some speak some english but most dont i definitly would go back awesome sunshine
reviews.title: great stay, worth the trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are just back from 2 weeks at the Iberostar Bavaro and selected this resort based on it's very high ranking on TA. This resort was certainly more pricey than others but overall we were really happy with our choice and felt the high ranking in TA was certainly justified.
reviews.title: Excellent - you won't be disappointed

reviews.text: Based on our experiences I don't think that the resort justified 5. The Iberostar came close, see below for why.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Buffet Food - this is why we chose this resort. 2 weeks of most places buffet would be a strain. Here the veggies were always hot and not overcooked or soggy. There was always freshly cooked steaks/pork/chicken/fish. Something for everyone each time - best buffet foos I've had bar none.
reviews.title: By Far the Best Trip hands down!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read every review for this resort in the 2 months leading up our trip. The resort was everything that people said it would be. It was beautiful. The grounds, rooms, restaurants, and beach were all top notch. The shows were great as well. My husband and I needed a vacation and this one certainly met our expectations. Be sure to dine in the Steakhouse which we went to 2 times during our 6 day stay. We went to the casino, the Star Rock Cafe (just okay) and all of the shows. The weather was 85 degrees everyday even though the weather forecast called for scattered showers everyday. Make sure to take some money to tip the staff since I'm sure they don't get paid much. We saw one waiter and waitress everyday at breakfast and the same ones at dinner so they definitely work long hours. There did seem to be a lot of kids at this resort so if you are looking for a kid free resort this is not for you. We did not mind this but some people might. They have several frozen drinks which they serve all day long such as pina colada, strawberry daiquari, coco loco and mixed drinks as well as presidente beer. Food flows all day so you can always get something to eat no matter what time it is. This was our first time to Punta Cana and would recommend this hotel to everyone. We would most certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Would highly recommend this resort

reviews.text: We stayed in the Bávaro from January 3rd until January 24th. There are already plenty of reviews about the Bávaro, so I'll try to sum up what we liked and didn't like.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: The review ahead of mine - (from Pattyann63 from NJ )wrote a great review --one that I can only reiterate!! It was a great vacation and we already miss the great staff and entertainers - Lewinske, Wilson, etc. The food was great, the hotel immaculate and the excursion snorkeling was magnificent. The tour guide even made us creme de cocoa from scratch on board. If you go, dont miss this one. Apple tours recommends it - and it was fabulous.
reviews.title: our second time & not disappointed yet!!!!

likes.disliked: — no bottled water at bars or pool

reviews.text: Our daughter was married at the Iberostar Bavaro in Punta Cana on December 6, 2008. She hired a wedding planner in the United States to help communicate better with the wedding planner at the Iberostar. We went through a travel agent in order to make certain all the plans for our guests would be flawless. We started all the planning in March, 2008, a full 9 months before the wedding to assure that everything went perfect. Alas...all the planning was to no avail. What our guests witnessed and what the newly married couple and her parents had to go through leaves me spellbound.
reviews.title: Wedding Day Disaster

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds and beach, great food, good entertainment
likes.disliked: — Total lack of communication between guests and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wedding ceremony was set on a spectacular stretch of beach. The chairs were set up for our 70 guests; however, the yellow caution tape surrounding the wedding ceremony is quite visible in all pictures, ruining the ambience. The couple arranged for a Dominican Justice of thePeace to marry them. (We have many e-mails confirming this) As I stood beside my husband, I kept asking, "Where is the justice of the peace?" :Who is going to marry them?" Much to our surprise, the wedding planner dressed in her Iberostar uniform stepped up to perform the ceremony. After the ceremony, the confusion began. We had arranged for the guests to have champagne timmediately following the ceremony but no one communicated this to our guests .They eventually figured out that the champagne was for them and started to drift toward the table. The wedding party was taking pictures with the photographer as our wedding guests tried to "guess" where to go next. We had arranged for cocktails and hors'dourves outside the reception at the Steakhouse; however, nothing was set up when our guests arrived. The guests started to arrange the tables with votive candles, light the candles and then tried to track down the bartender. We paid extra for all of this to be prepared when our guests arrived. The bride and groom were left alone on the beach after the photographer finished. They walked by themselves back to the "cocktail hour." The tables were not ready at the Steak House and we waited for over an hour before entering the steakhouse. Finally, the guests just stormed in. The bride and groom were once again left on their own to figure out what to do. With everyone seated, the bride and groom waited to be announced; however, there was no one to announce them as husband and wife. With the bride in tears, I stepped onto the dance floor, grabbed the michrophone and announced the newly married couple. Where was the wedding planner?? She was at another wedding taking place at the same time!! We had 75 people attending our wedding. She was at the wedding with 20 people. The salad bar was set up but there was no one there to direct our guests as to when to start getting their salad. Once again...I grabbed the microphone and told our guests to start making their way to the salad bar. Finally things settled down and the waiters started to take drink and dinner orders. Things were starting to run smoothly but not for long. Just as the cake was served, I noticed one of the waiters dressed in his Iberostar uniform guzzling a beer. I went to him and asked him to please return to serving our guests. He danced provocatively toward me and began to "grind" me. I ordered him to stop and he quickly apologized. I walked to my seat with him following me and apologizing profusely. He put his tray down on the floor beside me and spilled a full glass of beer all over my shoes, feet and the floor under my table. A wedding guest sitting beside me mopped the mess off the floor under me. Once again, I asked the waiter to "Please, wait on our guests and get me a glass of wine." A few minutes later, I saw the same waiter at a guests' table with a bottle of wine and some glasses. I walked toward him and asked him to please pour me a glass of wine. What happened next is so humiliating. He drank from the bottle of wine and then poured some into a glass and handed it to me. He walked behind me, grabbed me in the groin and started to "grind" me from behind. My brother saw what was happening and raced over to get the waiter away from me. I quickly spoke to one of the managers. He was dressed in a plaid shirt with a western style tie. The manager laughed at me but shortly after, I noticed that the waiter had been sent out of the wedding. Immediately after this episode, the disc jockey shut down all his equipment and the wedding abruptly ended. What a nightmare for the newly married couple. They thought they were being married in paradise. It ended up to be a wedding from hell.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Punta Cana

reviews.text: I spoke to the Iberostar wedding planner and manager of the Iberostar Bavaro. They fired the waiter and offered to give my husband and myself a free 5 day stay...but what about the bride and groom. Their wedding day is forever gone and marked by humiliation and disappointment.
reviews.title: Fantastic place for a vacation

likes.liked: — the beach, the food and the relaxed atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Iberostar Bavaro is a beautiful resort. The food is fabulous, the beach breathtaking and the grounds and rooms immaculate. Go there to vacation but do not get married there.
reviews.title: Best Iberostar and Great Choice for Punta Cana

reviews.text: My parents, husband and I went to Punta Cana for a destination wedding and were amazed at how wonderful the Bavaro hotel was. The rooms are quite large, with either a king bed or 2 double beds and a large sitting area with 2 couches. The entire resort was beautifully landscaped and had wonderful Christmas lights up that looked wonderful at night.
reviews.title: Very Nice Vacation

reviews.text: We went to the Iberostar Bavaro from March 14-21st and we absolutely loved it!!! The weather was great (it only rained once for 5 minutes). There was plenty of good food and we loved the a la carte restuarants. The breakfast at the main buffet is excellent. Yes, we had some stomach issues (very minor) about the 3rd or 4th day but it wasn't something we couldn't handle. We brought our own drink mugs which I highly recommend for drinks by the pool/beach area. After a few days the bartenders were familiar with us/drinks by our mugs. We did the safari excursion and had a really good time (bring your camera). The grounds are beautiful and it was just as nice as we imagined it would be. I would definitely recommend this resort!
reviews.title: Amazing Time

reviews.text: P.S. Thank you for an amazing time Honey.
reviews.title: Amazing time!
Fine, but a heads up
reviews.text: I came back a few weeks ago from here and had to write. I went down with 2 other girlfriends and had a blast. We weren't the typical age group that you see at the hotel, but we still had so much fun!

reviews.title: Shaken but not Stirred...................
reviews.text: Our room was very nice. All 3 of us did share it, one of us slept on the couch which was made into a bed. There was plenty of room for all of us and our stuff. We didn't have any problems with our room smelling weird, needing to be redone. Our AC was always on, even when we left. The only time we noticed it turned off was when we opened the door or slider. Housekeeping was always friendly and did a wonderful job, but we also did leave them money everyday.
Our room was close to the lobby and the peacocks, which we found entertaining. If you're not an animal person, I can see how they could get annoying, but they are there for their beauty.
reviews.title: Loved the Iberostar Bavaro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husbnd and I stayed at this resort September 8th through the 15th 2008. Our room was wonderful. The service was great. The grounds were beautiful. Everything was great while we were there. We tipped in the restuarants and the wait staff never forgot us. My husband tipped the cook and a rib eye steak was his anytime. That was at the buffet.
reviews.title: It was so wonderful until we got home....

likes.liked: — The room was average, very clean but it had a very comfortable bed.

reviews.text: It wasn't until a month after we got home that we realized there was a problem. The fraud department at our bank called. Our bank account had been compromised from someone in the Dominican. We had stayed in Punta Cana and the charges were coming from Santa Domingo. My husband had only used his debit card at the ATM in front of the bank on the resort.
reviews.title: Great week at the Punta Cana - Bavaro beach

likes.disliked: — Beside the hotel, there was nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do remember that one day when we came back from the pool our safe was open. Of course I asked my husband and he said that he thought that he closed it. We checked everthing and everything seemed to be there.
reviews.title: Nice resort, but there are a few things to be aware of ...

reviews.text: The bank believes that my husband's card was compromised directly from our safe. All the information about you is in the strip on the back of your card. Who ever compromised our account actually has my husbands pin number.
reviews.title: The Best Vacation in Years, Sykesville, MD, USA

likes.disliked: — roads to get from airport to resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So a word to the wise make sure you don't bring any cards with you, only bring travelers checks or cash. I'm not sure how safe either would be at this resort.
reviews.title: Nice honeymoon vacation

likes.disliked: — There was nothing that really disliked

reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 weeks in the Iberostar Bavaro with 2 friends and we all agree that this is a fantastic holiday for the money. The rooms are very large,we had junior suites, with huge double beds, settees in the room and big bathroom with bath and shower. They provide shower gel, shampoo in the shower and also small bottles +lotion, shower cap and sewing kit which was topped up when used. There is also a full sized iron and ironing board and umbrella provided,
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Wonderful beach and Brilliant staff

reviews.text: The staff were all brilliant and smiled from breakfast to night and nothing was too much trouble. The entertainment was excellent and again the staff were on the go the whole time even coming down on the beach in fancy dress just for fun. There were also two beach parties while we were there where they all dressed up and danced with the visitors.
reviews.title: Iberostars are just that much better!

reviews.text: I cannot imagine anyone going there and not finding something to eat that they enjoyed. We had lobster, prawns, hot and cold food both at lunch times and evenings that was more than plentiful. The speciality restaurants were good but we found that the gourmet was so cold that it spoiled the evening. the staff were also not as welcoming as they were in all the others. I would suggest taking a wrap when going to any of the indoor ones as the air conditioning is quite high in them (excluding the buffet) The only thing we all hated was the wine, both white and red, were undrinkable by our standards and we are not that fussy.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Another bonus is that although we did tip all the staff they did not stand there and wait for it as we found in Cuba.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great staff!

reviews.text: The weather was fantastic only dull and wet on the day we left but there was a light breeze most days which was lovely on the beach as stopped you getting too hot.
reviews.title: Our best vacation ever

reviews.text: We just returned from a 7 days vacation in the IB Bavaro... simply put, it was a very pleasant experience for me, my wife and my 3 y/old son.
reviews.title: Great service and a beautiful place...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very cozy and clean, the "all included" service included everything indeed, the food was very good and the staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Perfect stay at the Iberostar Bavaro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only suggestion to the hotel would be to enhance the number of people servicing the beach... you may have to walk a couple of hundred yards to the pool bar if you want your drink fast.
reviews.title: A week in paradise!!!

reviews.text: Other than that... we had the most amazing time in Punta Cana.

description: Directly on the beautiful, kilometre-long beach of Bavaro. Tropical gardens. Elegant Caribbean flair. Top 5-star luxury. 11 restaurants. First–Class international shows.
